segments.text: I'm observing the adult woman in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely engrossed in drying a plate with a dish towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so intense; it's almost admirable in its singularity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: However, this intense focus has made her oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing right in front of her, and she doesn't notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is growing, and her foot is clearly in it, yet no reaction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's quite shocking to witness such a complete lack of awareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Behind her, the children are making a daring raid on the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's missing all the drama and potential hazards unfolding around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated by her unawareness, honestly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone could get hurt or the kitchen could get seriously damaged.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's as if she's in her own peaceful bubble, completely detached.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and make her look!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of absorption is quite profound, if not a little alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I've never seen such a vivid example of being in one's own world.
segments.speaker: PAR
